alert.note: Alert for Yavapai County Mountains; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 22 at 1:39PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Yavapai County through 215 PM MST... At 138 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Wilhoit, or 8 miles southwest of Prescott, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail possible. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Prescott, Wilhoit, Downtown Prescott, Ponderosa Park, Groom Creek Subdivision, Walker, Indian Hill West Prescott, Oak Knoll Village, Prescott Gateway Mall, Lower Wolf Creek Campground, Upper Wolf Creek Group Campground and White Spar Campground. This includes the following highways... State Route 89 between mile markers 295 and 315. State Route 69 between mile markers 294 and 296. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Yavapai County Mountains; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins
